result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Michael J Boss in court with attorney Robert Allen Thorson.  Defendant Michael J Boss in custody.  James Jay Rennicke appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Heard along with 15CF131, 15CF142, 15CF182.  DE will waive PH hearing in 15CF182, court instructs on waiver of PH, will accept waiver, Court finds probable cause exists, will bind over for JT.  Information filed by the State.  Court recites case settlement into the court record.  Court instructs on plea questionnaire/waiver of rights.  DE will enter plea's in 15CF131-Ct 1, repeater dismissed and 15CF142-Ct's 1 and 2, repeater dismissed.  Ct 2 in 15CF131, 15CF122, 15CF142-Ct 3 and 15CF182 will be DRI.  Court will accept the recommendations of the parties.  DE makes a statement to the court, wishes to seek treatment and counseling.   

15CF131-NC-Withhold sentence, 5 years probation, will serve 30 days jail, with huber.  De will comply with all programming recommended per the DOC, CC, restitution to be determined, DNA sample/surcharge.

15CF142-NC, withhold sentence, 3 years probation, each count, concurrent with 15CF131 and each count,  CC, DNA surcharge, complete all programming recommended by the DOC.  Repeater dismissed on each case.

DE will enter plea's in 15CF131-Ct 1, repeater dismissed and 15CF142-Ct's 1 and 2, repeater dismissed.  Ct 2 in 15CF131, 15CF122, 15CF142-Ct 3 and 15CF182 will be DRI.  Court will accept the recommendations of the parties.  DE makes a statement to the court, wishes to seek treatment and counseling.   

15CF131-NC-Withhold sentence, 5 years probation, will serve 30 days jail, with huber.  De will comply with all programming recommended per the DOC, CC, restitution to be determined, DNA sample/surcharge.

15CF142-NC, withhold sentence, 3 years probation, each count, concurrent with 15CF131 and each count,  CC, DNA surcharge, complete all programming recommended by the DOC.  Repeater dismissed on each case.

DE will do daily PBT's randomly, at the direction of the SD.  DE must come for test within 15 minutes of SD call.  DE must reside with his parents.  DE is not to consume or possess alcohol.  Do not enter premises where alcohol is primary business, any bars, taverns or liquor stores.

ADDRESS INFO for Michael J Boss
Current: WILL PROVIDE SISTERS ADDRESS,   (Effective: 07-29-2015)
Prior: N4090 Meadow Brook Road, Ladysmith, WI 54848

DE will do daily PBT's,  randomly,  at the direction of the SD, DE must come for test within 15 minutes of SD call.   DE must reside with his sister.    Defendant is not to consume or possess alcohol.  Do not enter premises where alcohol is primary business, any bars, taverns or liquor stores.

Defendant Michael J Boss in court with attorney Annette M Barna.  Defendant Michael J Boss in custody.  James Jay Rennicke appeared for the State of Wisconsin.    Waive formal reading of the CC.  Atty wishes to address the issue of bond.  Atty wishes to convert cash bond to sign bond, had a job interview, has possible employment. Court will lift the no contact with sister on previous bond.   Court will order a $2500.00 sign bond, will do daily PBT's,  randomly,  at the direction of the SD, DE must come for test within 15 minutes of SD call.   DE must reside with his sister.    Defendant is not to consume or possess alcohol.  Do not enter premises where alcohol is primary business, any bars, taverns or liquor stores.  DE will waive time limits for PH.  Set for PH 8-25-15 @ 1:00PM.  DE must update address at his sisters before he leaves the courthouse today.
No possession or consumption of alcohol or illicit or illegal drugs.  No possession of any substance intended to alter DE's mental status or mood.
